content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)::AbstractString
    cleaned_col = lowercase(strip(col)) # lowercase the input and remove leading/trailing whitespaces
    cleaned_col = replace(cleaned_col, r"[ -]+" => "_") # replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    return cleaned_col
end
```

The `clean_column` function first lowercases the input string and strips any leading or trailing whitespaces. Then it replaces any spaces and hyphens with underscores using regular expressions. The resulting clean column name is returned.
